data.sentence: The word مِنْ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From

data.meanings: excel, distinguish, surpass, superior, gain/gift, bestow benefit/bounty/favour/grace
data.sentence: The word فَضْلِهِ comes from the root ف ض ل and is associated with the meanings: excel, distinguish, surpass, superior, gain/gift, bestow benefit/bounty/favour/grace

data.meanings: protect, cover over, shield, forgive, pardon.
data.sentence: The word غَفُورٌ comes from the root غ ف ر and is associated with the meanings: protect, cover over, shield, forgive, pardon.
The word أُجُورَهُمْ comes from the root ا ج ر and is associated with the meanings: recompense/compensation/reward, hire/pay/wage for service, profit

data.sentence: The word وَيَزِيدَهُمْ comes from the root ز ي د and is associated with the meanings: increased/augmented/grew, exceeded, was/became redundant/superfluous, remain over & above, addition, exaggerate, accessory, surplus

data.meanings: to reach the end, keep ones promise, fulfil ones engagement, pay a debt, perform a promise. tawaffa - to die. wafaat - death.
data.sentence: The word لِيُوَفِّيَهُمْ comes from the root و ف ي and is associated with the meanings: to reach the end, keep ones promise, fulfil ones engagement, pay a debt, perform a promise. tawaffa - to die. wafaat - death.

data.meanings: to give thanks, be grateful, realize or acknowledge one's favour, praise. shukrun - giving thanks, gratitude. shaakirun - one who gives thanks or is grateful, appreciated and bountiful in reward.. shakruurun - thankful. Sometimes a distinction is made between this word and shaakirun. The former is used to denote a person who is thankful for little or for nothing, the latter grateful for large favours.. mashkuurun - gratefully accepted, acceptable.
data.sentence: The word شَكُورٌ comes from the root ش ك ر and is associated with the meanings: to give thanks, be grateful, realize or acknowledge one's favour, praise. shukrun - giving thanks, gratitude. shaakirun - one who gives thanks or is grateful, appreciated and bountiful in reward.. shakruurun - thankful. Sometimes a distinction is made between this word and shaakirun. The former is used to denote a person who is thankful for little or for nothing, the latter grateful for large favours.. mashkuurun - gratefully accepted, acceptable.
